intro: Brunellia dulcis, commonly known as the sweet-scented bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface, while its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, smooth seeds.
